SENT.plain: The changing angiographic appearance of a cerebral arteriovenous malformation (AVM) illustrated hemodynamic changes that can occur following subarachnoid hemorrhage and antifibrinolytic therapy
Decreased size of this lesion suggested thrombosis of the AVM
This appearance actually represented a transient, vasospastic phenomenon which reversed with time
Although the AVM underwent significant changes acutely, little changed in the long term
